summary.executive_narrative: Your website is set up to help with growing your online presence and building credibility — but a few gaps are quietly working against you. Right now, search engines have less confidence ranking your pages, which means fewer people find you. Additionally, some visitors may struggle with slow loading or usability issues, which can drive them away. On the positive side, your site is encrypted and secure for visitors, your site works well on phones and tablets and you're tracking how visitors interact with your site. These are solid foundations to build on. We found 3 areas for improvement that could strengthen your position with visitors. The gaps we found are common and fixable — none require rebuilding your site.

whats_working.title: SSL/HTTPS enabled
whats_working.description: Site serves all pages over HTTPS with a valid certificate.

whats_working.title: Mobile viewport configured
whats_working.description: The site includes a proper viewport meta tag for mobile devices.

whats_working.title: Google Analytics active
whats_working.description: We detected Google Analytics tracking code on the site.

needs_attention.title: No sitemap found
needs_attention.description: We could not find a sitemap.xml at standard locations.

needs_attention.title: Slow page load (mobile)
needs_attention.description: Mobile performance score is below acceptable thresholds.

needs_attention.title: Missing alt text on images
needs_attention.description: Several images lack descriptive alt attributes.

metrics.name: Performance
metrics.meaning: Below average — page loads slowly on mobile devices.
metrics.why_it_matters: Slow sites lose visitors and may rank lower in search results.

metrics.name: Accessibility Risk
metrics.meaning: Some accessibility issues detected that may affect users with disabilities.

evidence.description: Missing lang attribute on html element

metrics.why_it_matters: Accessibility issues can exclude users and create legal risk.

metrics.name: Maintainability
metrics.meaning: Site structure appears consistent across sampled pages.
metrics.why_it_matters: Consistent structure reduces maintenance cost and user confusion.

metrics.name: Security Posture
metrics.meaning: HTTPS present but some security headers missing.
metrics.why_it_matters: Missing security headers increase risk of attacks and data exposure.

metrics.name: Integration Posture
metrics.meaning: Site uses Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager, and a contact form plugin.
metrics.why_it_matters: Third-party integrations add functionality but also maintenance burden.

metrics.name: Reliability Posture
metrics.meaning: We cannot detect uptime monitoring from public signals alone.
metrics.why_it_matters: Without monitoring, downtime may go unnoticed and damage reputation.

issues.title: No sitemap.xml found
issues.why_it_matters: Search engines may discover pages inconsistently without a sitemap.
issues.what_happens_if_ignored: New or updated pages may take longer to appear in search results.
what_to_do: Generate a sitemap.xml using your CMS or a tool like xml-sitemaps.com
Submit the sitemap to Google Search Console
Add a Sitemap directive to robots.txt
issues.expected_impact: Improved page discovery speed. Most sites see indexed pages increase within 2-4 weeks.

issues.title: Slow Largest Contentful Paint (mobile)
issues.why_it_matters: LCP above 2.5s indicates the main content loads slowly, frustrating users.
issues.what_happens_if_ignored: Higher bounce rates and potential ranking penalties from Core Web Vitals.
what_to_do: Optimize the largest image/element above the fold
Enable image compression and modern formats (WebP/AVIF)
issues.expected_impact: Improving LCP below 2.5s typically reduces bounce rate by 10-25%.

issues.title: Images missing alt text

evidence.description: 5 images found without alt attributes across 3 pages

issues.why_it_matters: Screen readers cannot describe these images to visually impaired users.
issues.what_happens_if_ignored: Accessibility compliance risk and missed image search traffic.
what_to_do: Add descriptive alt text to all content images
Use empty alt="" only for decorative images
issues.expected_impact: Better accessibility compliance and potential image search visibility.

checklist_30d.why_it_matters: Ensures search engines discover all your pages.
Directly impacts user experience and Core Web Vitals.

checklist_30d.action: Add alt text to all images
checklist_30d.why_it_matters: Required for accessibility and helps image search.

checklist_30d.action: Add HSTS and CSP security headers
checklist_30d.why_it_matters: Protects users from man-in-the-middle attacks and XSS.
Ensures you know about downtime before your customers do.

limitations.title: Algorithm changes
limitations.description: Search engine algorithms change frequently. Rankings can shift without any action on your part.

limitations.title: Competitor actions
limitations.description: Competitors may improve their sites at any time, affecting relative positioning.

limitations.title: Operational capacity
limitations.description: Implementation speed depends on your team's availability and technical skills.

limitations.title: Seasonality
limitations.description: Search traffic naturally varies by season and industry trends.

limitations.title: Service quality
limitations.description: Online presence cannot compensate for service quality issues.

limitations.title: Brand and word of mouth
limitations.description: Offline reputation significantly impacts online performance in ways we cannot measure.

top_improvements.title: Improve page loading speed
top_improvements.description: Your main content takes too long to appear, which frustrates visitors and may hurt your search rankings.

top_improvements.title: Help search engines find your pages
top_improvements.description: Without a sitemap, search engines may miss important pages on your site.

top_improvements.title: Make your site accessible to all visitors
top_improvements.description: Some images lack descriptions, making them invisible to visitors using screen readers.
